p:
The good activities reported for this drug as well as the search for safe and fast therapy for COVID-19 have prompted investigations on atazanavir. Marketed drugs that could act on the viral components of SARS-CoV-2 were analysed by Beck et al.
185 through a model of drug-target interaction called Molecule Transformer-Drug Target Interaction (MT-DTI). The binding affinity of 3.410 FDA-approved-drugs against 3CL pro proteinase, RdRp, helicase, exonuclease 3′–5′, endoRNAse and SARS-CoV-2 2′-O-ribose methyltransferase. Results suggested atazanavir as the best drug because of its strong binding affinity to proteinase 3CL pro (K d 94.94 nM), RdRp (K d 25,92 nM), helicase ( K d 25,92 nM), 3′- para-5 'exonuclease ( K d 82,36 nM), 2′-o-ribose methyltransferase ( K d de 390,67 nM), and endoRNAse ( K d 50,32 nM). Therefore, it is likely that atazanavir can inhibit all subunits in the SARS-CoV-2 replication complex at the same time.
